content: This channel will be used for planning November's CTCFT :smile:

For next month, some of the ideas that are out there:

  • Lib team update (@Mara?)
  • Rust in Linux (Paul McKenney?)
  • A Rust Writers Group (@Forest Anderson [he/him])

Any other suggestions/self-nominations are welcome :smiley:

A Rust Writers Group

Could you elaborate on this a bit? :smile:
We are envisioning a team of technical writers to help other teams / ppl write blog posts to further share what they are working on.
Neat! I'm definitely interested in that :smile:
I think Rust in Linux is probably one that we should have as its own theme. (i.e., on its own)
I'm curious whether there are things going on in #t-devtools
So for right now, the game plan is to see if we can get Paul in to do a Rust in Linux talk. @Josh Triplett is reaching out to them, and we'll see what we hear back.
Ideally, this talk will be long enough to fill the whole CTCFT
Another thought of a possible topic: perhaps @Aidan Hobson Sayers you'd like to talk about charters?
(Not for Nov necessarily, just at some point)

Forest Anderson [he/him] said:

So for right now, the game plan is to see if we can get Paul in to do a Rust in Linux talk. Josh Triplett is reaching out to them, and we'll see what we hear back.

(this is still in progress)
I've reached out and made the introduction, and Paul is interested.
The page for the November CTCFT is out: https://rust-ctcft.github.io/ctcft/meetings/2021-11-22.html
We pushed the normal schedule back a week, so it will be on the fourth Monday (the 22nd), not the third.
We'll be having a longer single talk for this meetup. We've invited some of the people working to integrate Rust into the Linux kernel to come and speak.

Forest Anderson [he/him] said:

We pushed the normal schedule back a week, so it will be on the fourth Monday (the 22nd), not the third.

Awesome, I'll actually be able to attend then. :)
Great to hear :smiley:
